It is a low-growing herb that typically thrives in sandy or coastal soils, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Ophiorrhiza longe-repens is well adapted to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and preventing erosion.
